title.value: Going beyond the means: Exploring the role of bias from digital determinants of health in technologies
title.justification: This is the title mentioned at the top of the paper.
title.quote: Going beyond the means: Exploring the role of bias from digital determinants of health in technologies

extractions.description: This narrative review assesses digital determinants of health (DDoH) in medical technologies that demonstrate bias or suboptimal performance, identifies potential mechanisms behind such biases, and proposes methods to address these disparities.

type.justification: The paper compiles and assesses various studies to explore bias in medical technologies.
type.quote: While previous articles have focused on social and economic determinants of health, this narrative review investigates digital determinants of health, as defined earlier in this collection [1].

name.justification: The paper is published in PLOS Digital Health and focuses on digital determinants of health.
name.quote: this narrative review assesses digital determinants of health (DDoH) in both technologies and medical formulae

name.justification: The review specifically covers biases in medical devices such as pulse oximeters and thermometers.
name.quote: This review scope specifically excludes technologies incorporating artificial intelligence and machine learning. For each technology, we identify both clinical and research recommendations.

name.justification: The focus is on identifying and addressing biases in medical technologies.
name.quote: identifies potential mechanisms behind such bias, and proposes potential methods or avenues that can guide future efforts to address these disparities.
